template.name: Template App Redis (agent2)
template.description:
From: https://git.zabbix.com/projects/ZBX/repos/zabbix/browse/templates/db/redis/template_db_redis.xml
Get Redis metrics from plugin for the New Zabbix Agent (zabbix-agent2).
You can discuss this template or leave feedback on our forum https://www.zabbix.com/forum/zabbix-suggestions-and-feedback/389050-discussion-thread-for-official-zabbix-template-redis
Template tooling version used: 0.33

item.name: Redis: Blocked clients
item.description: The number of connections waiting on a blocking call

item.name: Redis: Connected clients
item.description: The number of connected clients

item.name: Redis: Max input buffer
item.description: The biggest input buffer among current client connections

parameters.parameter: var clients = JSON.parse(value).Clients return clients.client_recent_max_input_buffer || clients.client_biggest_input_buf

item.name: Redis: Max output buffer
item.description: The biggest output buffer among current client connections

parameters.parameter: var clients = JSON.parse(value).Clients return clients.client_recent_max_output_buffer || clients.client_longest_output_list

item.name: Redis: Cluster enabled
item.description: Indicate Redis cluster is enabled

item.name: Redis: Max clients
item.description: Max number of connected clients at the same time. Once the limit is reached Redis will close all the new connections sending an error "max number of clients reached".

trigger.name: Redis: Configuration has changed on {HOST.NAME}
trigger.description: Redis configuration has changed. Ack to close.

item.name: Redis: CPU sys
item.description: System CPU consumed by the Redis server

item.name: Redis: CPU sys children
item.description: System CPU consumed by the background processes

item.name: Redis: CPU user
item.description: User CPU consumed by the Redis server

item.name: Redis: CPU user children
item.description: User CPU consumed by the background processes

trigger.name: Redis: Failed to fetch info data (or no data for 30m) on {HOST.NAME}
trigger.description: Zabbix has not received data for items for the last 30 minutes

item.name: Redis: Memory fragmentation ratio
item.description:
This ratio is an indication of memory mapping efficiency: — Value over 1.0 indicate that memory fragmentation is very likely. Consider restarting the Redis server so the operating system can recover fragmented memory, especially with a ratio over 1.5. — Value under 1.0 indicate that Redis likely has insufficient memory available. Consider optimizing memory usage or adding more RAM.
Note: If your peak memory usage is much higher than your current memory usage, the memory fragmentation ratio may be unreliable.
https://redis.io/topics/memory-optimization

trigger.name: Redis: Memory fragmentation ratio is too high (over {$REDIS.MEM.FRAG_RATIO.MAX.WARN} in 15m) on {HOST.NAME}
trigger.description:
This ratio is an indication of memory mapping efficiency: — Value over 1.0 indicate that memory fragmentation is very likely. Consider restarting the Redis server so the operating system can recover fragmented memory, especially with a ratio over 1.5. — Value under 1.0 indicate that Redis likely has insufficient memory available. Consider optimizing memory usage or adding more RAM.
Note: If your peak memory usage is much higher than your current memory usage, the memory fragmentation ratio may be unreliable.
https://redis.io/topics/memory-optimization

item.name: Redis: Memory used
item.description: Total number of bytes allocated by Redis using its allocator

item.name: Redis: Memory used Lua
item.description: Amount of memory used by the Lua engine

item.name: Redis: Memory used peak
item.description: Peak memory consumed by Redis (in bytes)

item.name: Redis: Memory used RSS
item.description: Number of bytes that Redis allocated as seen by the operating system

item.name: Redis: AOF current rewrite time sec
item.description: Duration of the on-going AOF rewrite operation if any

item.name: Redis: AOF enabled
item.description: Flag indicating AOF logging is activated

item.name: Redis: AOF last bgrewrite status
item.description: Status of the last AOF rewrite operation

item.name: Redis: AOF last rewrite time sec
item.description: Duration of the last AOF rewrite

item.name: Redis: AOF last write status
item.description: Status of the last write operation to the AOF

trigger.name: Redis: Last AOF write operation failed on {HOST.NAME}

item.name: Redis: AOF rewrite in progress
item.description: Flag indicating a AOF rewrite operation is on-going

item.name: Redis: AOF rewrite scheduled
item.description: Flag indicating an AOF rewrite operation will be scheduled once the on-going RDB save is complete

item.name: Redis: Dump loading
item.description: Flag indicating if the load of a dump file is on-going

item.name: Redis: RDB bgsave in progress
item.description: "1" if bgsave is in progress and "0" otherwise

item.name: Redis: RDB changes since last save
item.description: Number of changes since the last background save

item.name: Redis: RDB current bgsave time sec
item.description: Duration of the on-going RDB save operation if any

item.name: Redis: RDB last bgsave status
item.description: Status of the last RDB save operation

trigger.name: Redis: Last RDB save operation failed on {HOST.NAME}

item.name: Redis: RDB last bgsave time sec
item.description: Duration of the last bg_save operation

item.name: Redis: RDB last save time
item.description: Epoch-based timestamp of last successful RDB save

item.name: Redis: Connected slaves
item.description: Number of connected slaves

trigger.name: Redis: Number of slaves has changed on {HOST.NAME}
trigger.description: Redis number of slaves has changed.

item.name: Redis: Master replication offset
item.description: Replication offset reported by the master

item.name: Redis: Replication backlog active
item.description: Flag indicating replication backlog is active

item.name: Redis: Replication backlog first byte offset
item.description: The master offset of the replication backlog buffer

item.name: Redis: Replication backlog history length
item.description: Amount of data in the backlog sync buffer

item.name: Redis: Replication backlog size
item.description: Total size in bytes of the replication backlog buffer

item.name: Redis: Replication role
item.description: Value is "master" if the instance is replica of no one, or "slave" if the instance is a replica of some master instance. Note that a replica can be master of another replica (chained replication).

trigger.name: Redis: Replication role has changed (new role: {ITEM.VALUE}) on {HOST.NAME}

item.name: Redis: Process id
item.description: PID of the server process

item.name: Redis: Redis mode
item.description: The server's mode ("standalone", "sentinel" or "cluster")

item.name: Redis: Redis version
item.description: Version of the Redis server

trigger.name: Redis: Version has changed (new version: {ITEM.VALUE}) on {HOST.NAME}

item.name: Redis: TCP port
item.description: TCP/IP listen port

item.name: Redis: Uptime
item.description: Number of seconds since Redis server start

trigger.name: Redis: Too many entries in the slowlog (over {$REDIS.SLOWLOG.COUNT.MAX.WARN} per second in 5m) on {HOST.NAME}

item.name: Redis: Evicted keys
item.description: Number of evicted keys due to maxmemory limit

item.name: Redis: Expired keys
item.description: Total number of key expiration events

item.name: Redis: Instantaneous input bytes per second
item.description: The network's read rate per second in KB/sec

item.name: Redis: Instantaneous operations per sec
item.description: Number of commands processed per second

item.name: Redis: Instantaneous output bytes per second
item.description: The network's write rate per second in KB/sec

item.name: Redis: Keyspace hits
item.description: Number of successful lookup of keys in the main dictionary

item.name: Redis: Keyspace misses
item.description: Number of failed lookup of keys in the main dictionary

item.name: Redis: Latest fork usec
item.description: Duration of the latest fork operation in microseconds

item.name: Redis: Migrate cached sockets
item.description: The number of sockets open for MIGRATE purposes

item.name: Redis: Pubsub channels
item.description: Global number of pub/sub channels with client subscriptions

item.name: Redis: Pubsub patterns
item.description: Global number of pub/sub pattern with client subscriptions

item.name: Redis: Rejected connections
item.description: Number of connections rejected because of maxclients limit

trigger.name: Redis: Connections are rejected on {HOST.NAME}
trigger.description:
The number of connections has reached the value of "maxclients".
https://redis.io/topics/clients

item.name: Redis: Sync full
item.description: The number of full resyncs with replicas

item.name: Redis: Sync partial err
item.description: The number of denied partial resync requests

item.name: Redis: Sync partial ok
item.description: The number of accepted partial resync requests

item.name: Redis: Total commands processed
item.description: Total number of commands processed by the server

item.name: Redis: Total connections received
item.description: Total number of connections accepted by the server

item.name: Redis: Total net input bytes
item.description: The total number of bytes read from the network

item.name: Redis: Total net output bytes
item.description: The total number of bytes written to the network

discovery_rule.name: Process metrics discovery
discovery_rule.description: Collect metrics by Zabbix agent if it exists

item_prototype.name: Redis: CPU utilization
item_prototype.description: Process CPU utilization percentage.

item_prototype.name: Redis: Memory usage (rss)
item_prototype.description: Resident set size memory used by process in bytes.

item_prototype.name: Redis: Memory usage (vsize)
item_prototype.description: Virtual memory size used by process in bytes.

trigger_prototype.name: Redis: Process is not running on {HOST.NAME}

item_prototype.name: DB {#DB}: Average TTL
item_prototype.description: Average TTL

item_prototype.name: DB {#DB}: Expires
item_prototype.description: Number of keys with an expiration

item_prototype.name: DB {#DB}: Keys
item_prototype.description: Total number of keys

item_prototype.name: Redis: Active defrag running{#SINGLETON}
item_prototype.description: Flag indicating if active defragmentation is active

item_prototype.name: Redis: Lazyfree pending objects{#SINGLETON}
item_prototype.description: The number of objects waiting to be freed (as a result of calling UNLINK, or FLUSHDB and FLUSHALL with the ASYNC option)

item_prototype.name: Redis: Max memory{#SINGLETON}
item_prototype.description: Maximum amount of memory allocated to the Redisdb system

item_prototype.name: Redis: Max memory policy{#SINGLETON}
item_prototype.description: The value of the maxmemory-policy configuration directive

item_prototype.name: Redis: Total system memory{#SINGLETON}
item_prototype.description: The total amount of memory that the Redis host has

item_prototype.name: Redis: Memory used dataset{#SINGLETON}
item_prototype.description: The size in bytes of the dataset

item_prototype.name: Redis: Memory used dataset %{#SINGLETON}
item_prototype.description: The percentage of used_memory_dataset out of the net memory usage (used_memory minus used_memory_startup)

item_prototype.name: Redis: Memory used overhead{#SINGLETON}
item_prototype.description: The sum in bytes of all overheads that the server allocated for managing its internal data structures

item_prototype.name: Redis: Memory used peak %{#SINGLETON}
item_prototype.description: The percentage of used_memory_peak out of used_memory

item_prototype.name: Redis: Memory used startup{#SINGLETON}
item_prototype.description: Initial amount of memory consumed by Redis at startup in bytes

item_prototype.name: Redis: AOF last CoW size{#SINGLETON}
item_prototype.description: The size in bytes of copy-on-write allocations during the last AOF rewrite operation

item_prototype.name: Redis: RDB last CoW size{#SINGLETON}
item_prototype.description: The size in bytes of copy-on-write allocations during the last RDB save operation

item_prototype.name: Redis: Replication second offset{#SINGLETON}
item_prototype.description: Offset up to which replication IDs are accepted

item_prototype.name: Redis: Executable path{#SINGLETON}
item_prototype.description: The path to the server's executable

item_prototype.name: Redis: Active defrag hits{#SINGLETON}
item_prototype.description: Number of value reallocations performed by active the defragmentation process

item_prototype.name: Redis: Active defrag key hits{#SINGLETON}
item_prototype.description: Number of keys that were actively defragmented

item_prototype.name: Redis: Active defrag key misses{#SINGLETON}
item_prototype.description: Number of keys that were skipped by the active defragmentation process

item_prototype.name: Redis: Active defrag misses{#SINGLETON}
item_prototype.description: Number of aborted value reallocations started by the active defragmentation process

item_prototype.name: Redis: Expired time cap reached count{#SINGLETON}
Redis: Slave expires tracked keys{#SINGLETON}
item_prototype.description: The number of keys tracked for expiry purposes (applicable only to writable replicas)

trigger_prototype.name: Redis: Memory usage is too high (over {$REDIS.MEM.PUSED.MAX.WARN}% in 5m) on {HOST.NAME}

item_prototype.name: Redis: Memory AOF buffer{#SINGLETON}
item_prototype.description: Size of the AOF buffer

item_prototype.name: Redis: Memory not counted for evict{#SINGLETON}
Redis: Memory number of cached scripts{#SINGLETON}

discovery_rule.name: AOF metrics discovery
discovery_rule.description: If AOF is activated, additional metrics will be added

item_prototype.name: Redis: AOF base size{#SINGLETON}
item_prototype.description: AOF file size on latest startup or rewrite

item_prototype.name: Redis: AOF buffer length{#SINGLETON}
item_prototype.description: Size of the AOF buffer

item_prototype.name: Redis: AOF current size{#SINGLETON}
item_prototype.description: AOF current file size

item_prototype.name: Redis: AOF delayed fsync{#SINGLETON}
item_prototype.description: Delayed fsync counter

item_prototype.name: Redis: AOF pending background I/O fsync{#SINGLETON}
item_prototype.description: Number of fsync pending jobs in background I/O queue

item_prototype.name: Redis: AOF pending rewrite{#SINGLETON}
item_prototype.description: Flag indicating an AOF rewrite operation will

item_prototype.name: Redis: AOF rewrite buffer length{#SINGLETON}
item_prototype.description: Size of the AOF rewrite buffer

discovery_rule.name: Replication metrics discovery
discovery_rule.description: If the instance is the master and the slaves are connected, additional metrics are provided

item_prototype.name: Redis slave {#SLAVE_IP}:{#SLAVE_PORT}: Replication lag in bytes
item_prototype.description: Replication lag in bytes

discovery_rule.name: Slave metrics discovery
discovery_rule.description: If the instance is a replica, additional metrics are provided

item_prototype.name: Redis: Master host{#SINGLETON}
item_prototype.description: Host or IP address of the master

item_prototype.name: Redis: Master last I/O seconds ago{#SINGLETON}
item_prototype.description: Number of seconds since the last interaction with master

trigger_prototype.name: Redis: Replication lag with master is too high (over {$REDIS.REPL.LAG.MAX.WARN} in 5m) on {HOST.NAME}

item_prototype.name: Redis: Master link status{#SINGLETON}
item_prototype.description: Status of the link (up/down)

item_prototype.name: Redis: Master port{#SINGLETON}
item_prototype.description: Master listening TCP port

item_prototype.name: Redis: Master sync in progress{#SINGLETON}
item_prototype.description: Indicate the master is syncing to the replica

item_prototype.name: Redis: Slave priority{#SINGLETON}
item_prototype.description: The priority of the instance as a candidate for failover

item_prototype.name: Redis: Slave priority{#SINGLETON}
item_prototype.description: Flag indicating if the replica is read-only

item_prototype.name: Redis: Slave replication offset{#SINGLETON}
item_prototype.description: The replication offset of the replica instance

macro.description: Connection string in the URI format (password is not used). This param overwrites a value configured in the "Server" option of the configuration file (if it's set), otherwise, the plugin's default value is used: "tcp://localhost:6379"
Redis server process name for LLD
Maximum number of slowlog entries per second

trigger.name: Redis: Total number of connected clients is too high (over {$REDIS.CLIENTS.PRC.MAX.WARN}% in 5m) on {HOST.NAME}
trigger.description:
When the number of clients reaches the value of the "maxclients" parameter, new connections will be rejected.
https://redis.io/topics/clients#maximum-number-of-clients
